description: This is a tranquil trail that takes you on a serene journey around the picturesque Bear Lake. Nestled in the heart of the Rocky Mountain National Park, the trail offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. The well-marked trail is perfect for beginners and families, making it a popular choice for those seeking a peaceful hike in the midst of nature.
stages: Start at the Bear Lake Trailhead
Follow the well-marked trail
Enjoy views of the surrounding mountains
Complete the loop and return to the trailhead

description: This trail offers a unique opportunity to witness the stunning beauty of Bryce Canyon National Park. Starting at Sunset Point, the trail follows the Rim Trail, offering panoramic views of the amphitheater. The trail is easy to navigate, making it ideal for hikers of all levels. The highlight of the hike is reaching Sunrise Point, where you can enjoy an unforgettable sunrise.
stages: Start at Sunset Point
Follow the Rim Trail
Enjoy panoramic views of the amphitheater
Reach Sunrise Point
Return to Sunset Point along the same path

description: This trail is a delightful journey leading to the beautiful Taggart Lake. Located in Grand Teton National Park, the trail takes you through lush forests and meadows, offering a glimpse of the park’s diverse flora and fauna. The highlight of the trail is reaching Taggart Lake, a serene spot perfect for a picnic or a quiet moment of reflection.
stages: Start at the Taggart Lake Trailhead
Follow the trail through forests and meadows
Reach Taggart Lake
Return to the trailhead along the same path

description: This trail takes you on an enchanting journey to a beautiful waterfall. Starting at the Zion Lodge, the trail crosses the Virgin River and leads you to the Lower Emerald Pool. The waterfall is a sight to behold, and the trail offers several spots to relax and enjoy the view.
stages: Start at the Zion Lodge
Follow the trail across the Virgin River
Reach the Lower Emerald Pool
Return to the lodge along the same path

description: This trail is a scenic journey leading to the stunning Baring Falls. Starting at the Sunrift Gorge parking area, the trail takes you through a dense forest, offering a glimpse of the park’s rich biodiversity. The highlight of the trail is reaching Baring Falls, a majestic waterfall that is sure to leave you in awe.
stages: Start at the Sunrift Gorge parking area
Follow the trail through a forest
Reach Baring Falls
Return to the parking area along the same path

description: This trail takes you on a journey to the world’s largest tree, the General Sherman Tree. The trail is well-marked and easy to follow, making it suitable for hikers of all levels. The highlight of the trail is reaching the General Sherman Tree, a magnificent sight that is sure to leave you in awe.
stages: Start at the Main Parking Area
Follow the well-marked trail
Reach the General Sherman Tree
Return to the parking area along the same path

description: This trail offers a unique opportunity to view the famous Delicate Arch. The trail starts at the Delicate Arch Viewpoint parking area and leads you to a viewpoint offering stunning views of the arch. The trail is easy to navigate, making it ideal for hikers of all levels.
stages: Start at the Delicate Arch Viewpoint parking area
Follow the trail to the viewpoint
Enjoy views of Delicate Arch
Return to the parking area along the same path

description: This trail offers stunning views of the largest cliff dwelling in North America, the Cliff Palace. The trail starts at the Cliff Palace parking area and follows a loop trail, offering panoramic views of the Cliff Palace. The trail is easy to navigate, making it suitable for hikers of all levels.
stages: Start at the Cliff Palace parking area
Follow the loop trail
Enjoy views of Cliff Palace
Complete the loop and return to the parking area

description: This trail offers stunning views of Mount Rainier and its surrounding landscapes. The trail starts at the Pinnacle Peak Trailhead and leads you to a saddle offering panoramic views. The trail is well-marked and easy to navigate, making it ideal for hikers of all levels.
stages: Start at the Pinnacle Peak Trailhead
Follow the trail to the saddle
Enjoy panoramic views
Return to the trailhead along the same path

description: This trail takes you on a journey to a beautiful waterfall that you can walk behind. Starting at the Trillium Gap Trailhead, the trail takes you through an old-growth hemlock forest, offering a glimpse of the park’s rich biodiversity. The highlight of the trail is reaching Grotto Falls, a sight that is sure to leave you in awe.
stages: Start at the Trillium Gap Trailhead
Follow the trail through an old-growth hemlock forest
Reach Grotto Falls
Return to the trailhead along the same path

trailName: Navajo Loop and Queens Garden Trail
description: This moderate trail offers a unique opportunity to explore the stunning Bryce Canyon National Park. Starting at Sunrise Point, the trail descends the Queen’s Garden trail, leading you to the heart of the park. You’ll then follow the trail to Navajo Loop, ascending either side of the loop to Sunset Point. The trail offers breathtaking views of the park’s unique geological formations, making it a must-see for any visitor.
stages: Start at Sunrise Point
Descend the Queen's Garden trail
Reach Queen's Garden
Follow the trail to Navajo Loop
Ascend either side of Navajo Loop (Two Bridges or Wall Street) to Sunset Point
Complete the loop by walking the easy 0.5 mile portion of the Rim Trail back to where you started the hike

description: This challenging trail takes you on an exhilarating journey to a stunning viewpoint in Zion National Park. Starting at The Grotto Trailhead, you’ll cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail. After navigating a few sets of stone-carved staircases, you’ll reach Scout Lookout. From there, it’s a final climb to Angels Landing, where you’ll be rewarded with panoramic views of the park.
stages: Start at The Grotto Trailhead
Cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail
Navigate a few sets of stone-carved staircases
Reach Scout Lookout
Final climb to Angels Landing

trailName: Devil's Bridge Trail via Dry Creek Road
description: This moderate trail leads you to a natural sandstone arch in the Coconino National Forest. Starting at the Dry Creek Vista parking area, you’ll follow the ORV Vultee Arch Road up to the official trailhead. The trail takes you through washes filled with juniper and prickly pear cactus, eventually leading you to the base of the bridge. A natural rock staircase ascends to the bridge, offering a unique photo opportunity.
stages: Start at the Dry Creek Vista parking area
Follow the ORV Vultee Arch Road (Forest Road 152) up to the official trailhead
Hike through washes filled with juniper and prickly pear cactus
Reach the base of the bridge
Ascend a natural rock staircase
Reach the bridge

description: This challenging trail offers breathtaking views of Mount Rainier and its surrounding landscapes. Starting at the Jackson Visitor Center, you’ll follow signage for the Skyline Trail, navigating through pine forests and ascending the slopes to the base of Mount Rainier. Upon reaching Panorama Point, you’ll be treated to panoramic views of the park. The loop concludes with a return to the Jackson Visitor Center.
stages: Start at the Jackson Visitor Center
Follow signage for the Skyline Trail
Navigate through pine forests
Ascend the slopes to the base of Mount Rainier
Reach Panorama Point
Complete the loop and return to the Jackson Visitor Center

description: This moderate trail leads you to the stunning Emerald Lake in Rocky Mountain National Park. Starting at the Bear Lake Trailhead, you’ll hike past Myrtle Falls and walk through pine forests. The trail passes by Nymph Lake and Dream Lakes before finally reaching Emerald Lake. The serene lake, surrounded by towering peaks, offers a peaceful retreat for hikers.
stages: Start at the Bear Lake Trailhead
Hike past Myrtle Falls
Walk through pine forests
Pass by Nymph Lake and Dream Lakes
Reach Emerald Lake

description: This challenging trail leads you to the top of Half Dome, offering panoramic views of Yosemite Valley and the Sierra Nevada. Starting at the Happy Isles trailhead, you’ll hike to Vernal Fall and Nevada Fall before continuing to Little Yosemite Valley. From there, you’ll ascend the subdome and the Half Dome cables to reach the top of Half Dome. The trail concludes with a return to the trailhead along the same path.
stages: Start at the Happy Isles trailhead
Hike to Vernal Fall and Nevada Fall
Continue to Little Yosemite Valley
Ascend the subdome and the Half Dome cables
Reach the top of Half Dome
Return to the trailhead along the same path

description: This challenging trail descends into the Grand Canyon, offering stunning views of the canyon’s layers. Starting at the Bright Angel Trailhead, you’ll descend through a series of switchbacks, passing by the 1.5 Mile Resthouse and 3 Mile Resthouse. Upon reaching Indian Garden, you can continue to Plateau Point for views of the Colorado River before returning to the trailhead along the same path.
stages: Start at the Bright Angel Trailhead
Descend through a series of switchbacks
Pass by the 1.5 Mile Resthouse and 3 Mile Resthouse
Reach Indian Garden
Continue to Plateau Point for views of the Colorado River
Return to the trailhead along the same path

description: This challenging trail traverses the Garden Wall, offering panoramic views of Glacier National Park. Starting at the Logan Pass Visitor Center, you’ll follow the trail along the Garden Wall to reach the Granite Park Chalet. From there, you’ll continue to The Loop trailhead and take the shuttle back to Logan Pass.
stages: Start at the Logan Pass Visitor Center
Follow the trail along the Garden Wall
Reach the Granite Park Chalet
Continue to The Loop trailhead
Take the shuttle back to Logan Pass

description: This challenging trail leads you to Vernal Fall and Nevada Fall, offering stunning views of both waterfalls. Starting at the Happy Isles trailhead, you’ll hike to the Vernal Fall Footbridge before continuing to the top of Vernal Fall. From there, you’ll hike to the top of Nevada Fall. The trail concludes with a return to the trailhead along the John Muir Trail.
stages: Start at the Happy Isles trailhead
Hike to the Vernal Fall Footbridge
Continue to the top of Vernal Fall
Hike to the top of Nevada Fall
Return to the trailhead along the John Muir Trail

description: Rim Trail: This moderate trail follows the rim of the Grand Canyon, offering stunning views of the canyon. You can start at any viewpoint along Hermit Road or Desert View Drive and follow the trail along the rim. The trail offers panoramic views of the Grand Canyon, making it a great option for those looking to experience the grandeur of the canyon.
stages: Start at any viewpoint along Hermit Road or Desert View Drive
Follow the trail along the rim
Enjoy panoramic views of the Grand Canyon
Return to your starting point or take the shuttle to another viewpoint

description: This challenging trail offers an unforgettable journey across the Grand Canyon from the North Rim to the South Rim. Starting at the North Kaibab Trailhead, you’ll descend into the depths of the canyon, hiking along the mighty Colorado River. The trail then ascends to the South Rim via the Bright Angel Trail, offering a diverse and breathtaking perspective of the Grand Canyon’s geological wonders.
stages: Start at the North Kaibab Trailhead
Descend into the canyon
Hike along the Colorado River
Ascend to the South Rim via the Bright Angel Trail

description: This challenging trail leads you to the summit of Mount Whitney, the highest peak in the contiguous United States. Starting at the Whitney Portal, you’ll hike through the Whitney Zone, ascending the 99 Switchbacks, a test of endurance and determination. Upon reaching the summit of Mount Whitney, you’ll be rewarded with panoramic views of the Sierra Nevada.
stages: Start at the Whitney Portal
Hike through the Whitney Zone
Ascend the 99 Switchbacks
Reach the summit of Mount Whitney

description: This long-distance trail winds through the Sierra Nevada, offering stunning views of alpine and high mountain scenery. Starting at Happy Isles in Yosemite Valley, you’ll hike through the Ansel Adams Wilderness, continuing through Kings Canyon and Sequoia National Parks. The trail finishes at Mount Whitney, the highest peak in the contiguous United States, offering a sense of accomplishment and awe-inspiring views.
stages: Start at Happy Isles in Yosemite Valley
Hike through the Ansel Adams Wilderness
Continue through Kings Canyon and Sequoia National Parks
Finish at Mount Whitney, the highest peak in the contiguous United States

description: This challenging trail leads to the summit of Longs Peak, the highest peak in Rocky Mountain National Park. Starting at the Longs Peak Trailhead, you’ll hike to the Boulder Field, navigating the Keyhole, a unique rock formation. From there, you’ll ascend the Trough, traverse the Narrows, and climb the Homestretch to the summit, where you’ll be rewarded with panoramic views of the park.
stages: Start at the Longs Peak Trailhead
Hike to the Boulder Field
Navigate the Keyhole
Ascend the Trough, traverse the Narrows, and climb the Homestretch to the summit

description: This long-distance trail circles Mount Rainier, offering stunning views of the mountain and its surrounding landscapes. You can start at any of the trailheads along the loop, hiking through lowland forests and valleys, ascending and descending many ridges. Completing the loop at your starting point, you’ll have experienced a diverse range of ecosystems and breathtaking views.
stages: Start at any of the trailheads along the loop
Hike through lowland forests and valleys
Ascend and descend many ridges
Complete the loop at your starting point

description: This challenging trail leads to the summit of Mount Elbert, the highest peak in Colorado. Starting at the North Mount Elbert Trailhead, you’ll hike through the forest on a well-maintained trail, reaching the treeline and continuing on the rocky trail. Navigating a series of switchbacks to reach the summit, you’ll enjoy panoramic views from the top of Colorado.
stages: Start at the North Mount Elbert Trailhead
Hike through the forest on a well-maintained trail
Reach the treeline and continue on the rocky trail
Navigate a series of switchbacks to reach the summit
Enjoy panoramic views from the top of Colorado
Return to the trailhead along the same path

description: This challenging trail takes you through the narrowest section of Zion Canyon. Starting at Chamberlain’s Ranch, you’ll hike down the North Fork of the Virgin River, navigating through the Narrows, a dramatic slot canyon. The trail finishes at the Temple of Sinawava, offering a unique and unforgettable hiking experience.
stages: Start at Chamberlain's Ranch
Hike down the North Fork of the Virgin River
Navigate through the Narrows
Finish at the Temple of Sinawava

description: This challenging loop trail takes you over four mountain passes, offering stunning views of the Elk Mountains. Starting at Maroon Lake, you’ll hike over West Maroon Pass, Frigid Air Pass, Trail Rider Pass, and Buckskin Pass. Completing the loop at Maroon Lake, you’ll have experienced a diverse range of landscapes and breathtaking mountain views.
stages: Start at Maroon Lake
Hike over West Maroon Pass, Frigid Air Pass, Trail Rider Pass, and Buckskin Pass
Complete the loop at Maroon Lake

description: This challenging trail leads to the summit of Mount Katahdin, the highest peak in Maine. Starting at Roaring Brook Campground, you’ll hike to Chimney Pond, ascending the Dudley Trail to Pamola Peak. From there, you’ll traverse the Knife Edge to Baxter Peak, offering a thrilling and unforgettable hiking experience.
stages: Start at Roaring Brook Campground
Hike to Chimney Pond
Ascend the Dudley Trail to Pamola Peak
Traverse the Knife Edge to Baxter Peak

description: This challenging loop trail takes you through some of the most stunning scenery in the Sierra Nevada. Starting at Roads End, you’ll hike through Paradise Valley, ascending to Rae Lakes. Crossing Glen Pass, you’ll complete the loop at Roads End, having experienced a diverse range of landscapes and breathtaking mountain views.
stages: Start at Roads End
Hike through Paradise Valley
Ascend to Rae Lakes
Cross Glen Pass
Complete the loop at Roads End
